importantArticles.headline: LONDON (Reuters) -U.S. media giant Comcast Corp has chosen an area north of London for its first Universal theme park and resort in Europe, pledging to build rides and attractions based on its movie franchises that it hopes will rival Disneyland Paris.  The group, which owns the Jurassic Park and Back to the Future movie franchises and the Harry Potter theme park licence, said the park in Bedford would create 20,000 jobs during construction and a further 8,000 across the hospitality and creative industries when it opens in 2031.
importantArticles.title: Universal to open first European theme park near London

The analyst predicts that Comcast’s EBITDA for the first quarter of 2025 will be approximately $9.19 billion, slightly above the consensus estimate of $9.18 billion. Ng slightly lowered the first quarter Connectivity & Platforms EBITDA estimate to $8.21 billion from $8.22 billion prior, driven by a lower Wireless revenue estimate. importantArticles.headline: Comcast connected nearly 6,700 new homes and businesses in Mt. Vernon, Wrightsville, Soperton, Adrian, Glenwood, and Alamo, GA to reliable, high-speed Internet. This expansion into the region will enhance digital infrastructure, promote economic growth, and position residents and local businesses for success in an increasingly digital world. The network expansion brings Internet, mobile, and security services from Xfinity and Comcast Business to residents and businesses for the first time.
importantArticles.title: Comcast Expands Internet Services to Communities in Southeast, GA

importantArticles.headline: PHILADELPHIA, March 19, 2025--Comcast has launched a new, innovative gateway with Tri-Band WiFi 6E technology that delivers faster speeds, lower latency, and ‘Instant On’ connectivity to apartment residents. The gateway allows building owners to activate additional networks to power Smart technologies and provide residents and building staff with seamless WiFi coverage across an entire property. This industry-first, award-winning product is purpose-built and retrofit-friendly for the multifamily
importantArticles.title: Comcast Unveils Industry-First Gateway Designed for Apartment Buildings Enabling ‘Instant’ Connectivity for Residents

importantArticles.headline: PHILADELPHIA, March 19, 2025--Xfinity Communities, which serves multifamily properties nationwide, has introduced Connected Building, an end-to-end networking solution designed to deliver always-on, property-wide WiFi. The Connected Building solution transforms the way multifamily property owners achieve modern connectivity – both in unit and building-wide – at a price point much lower than traditional managed WiFi solutions.
importantArticles.title: Xfinity Communities Launches ‘Connected Building’ with Industry-First ‘Instant On’ Internet Experience for Apartment Buildings Nationwide

importantArticles.headline: NEW YORK, March 19, 2025--Comcast Corporation (Nasdaq: CMCSA) today announced that David Novak will become Chairman of the Board of Directors of "SpinCo," the company’s planned spin-off of select media brands and digital businesses. Mr. Novak previously served as the Co-Founder, Chairman and CEO of YUM! Brands, Inc. and will bring nearly 40 years of experience leading and growing well-known consumer brands to the new company’s board.
importantArticles.title: David Novak to Chair Comcast’s "SpinCo"
